author: ABC Radio National
title: Monday Finance with Sheryle Bagwell
text:
Monday 27 July 2015 6:52AM   Industry Super sector is stepping up its campaign against the Abbott Government's proposed shake-up of the governance of super funds, describing the reforms as the 'most radical' since the advent of compulsory super in 1992. 
The Government wants to bring in new laws ensuring a third of super fund trustees are independent directors. 
The move is widely seen as an attempt by the Government to reduce union influence over part of Australia's $2 trillion super savings pool. 
RN Breakfast 's Business Editor Sheryle Bagwell joins Fran Kelly to preview the week ahead in business and finance.
